de.malkusch.amazon.ecs

Class ProductAdvertisingAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.malkusch.amazon.ecs.ProductAdvertisingAPI

  • public class ProductAdvertisingAPI
extends Object
    Convenient API to Amazon's Product Advertising SOAP-API This API signs the SOAP messages for you. You have to provide an implementation of Configuration to make this API work properly. There exists an implementation which uses Properties. The underlying SOAP interface was generated with wsimport. You can still access the generated Proxy by calling getPort(). If you do so, you would produce mostly boiler plates. Use the API's ApiCall objects to avoid this.
    Author:
    Markus Malkusch
    See Also:
    http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/Welcome.html, http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/APPNDX_SearchIndexValues.html

      • getCartAdd

        public CartAddCall getCartAdd()
        Returns the ApiCall object for add an item into an existing remote shopping cart. CartAddRequest request = api.getCartAdd().buildRequest(existingCart); request.setItems(new CartAddRequest.Items()); CartAddRequest.Items.Item item = new CartAddRequest.Items.Item(); item.setASIN("3831019592"); item.setQuantity(BigInteger.valueOf(1)); request.getItems().getItem().add(item); Cart updatedCart = api.getCartAdd().call(request);
        See Also:
        http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/CartAdd.html

      • getCartModify

        public CartModifyCall getCartModify()
        Returns the ApiCall object for modifying an existing remote shopping cart. Modifying means changing the quantity, removing an item (quantity = 0) and moving items form the active area of a cart to the SaveForLater area or the reverse. CartModifyRequest request = api.getCartModify().buildRequest(existingCart); request.setItems(new CartModifyRequest.Items()); CartModifyRequest.Items.Item removedItem = new CartModifyRequest.Items.Item(); removedItem.setCartItemId(cartItemId); removedItem.setQuantity(BigInteger.valueOf(0)); request.getItems().getItem().add(removedItem); Cart updatedCart = api.getCartModify().call(request);
        See Also:
        http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/CartModify.html

      • getCartClear

        public CartClearCall getCartClear()
        Returns the ApiCall object for clearing an existing remote shopping cart. Clearing means removing all items from a shopping cart. Amazon doesn't let you delete a shopping cart. A shopping cart will be deleted automatically after its life span of 7 days. Cart updatedCart = api.getCartClear().call(existingCart);
        See Also:
        http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/CartClear.html

      • getCartGet

        public CartGetCall getCartGet()
        Returns the ApiCall object for getting an existing remote shopping cart. Because the contents of a cart can change for different reasons, such as availability, you should not keep a copy of a cart locally. Instead, use CartGet to retrieve the items in a remote shopping cart. Cart updatedCart = api.getCartGet().call(existingCart);
        See Also:
        http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/CartGet.html

      • getCartCreate

        public CartCreateCall getCartCreate()
        Returns the ApiCall object for creating a remote shopping cart. As required by Amazon, you can't create an empty shopping cart. CartCreateRequest request = new CartCreateRequest(); CartCreateRequest.Items items = new CartCreateRequest.Items(); request.setItems(items); Item item = new Item(); item.setASIN("383102037X"); item.setQuantity(BigInteger.valueOf(1)); items.getItem().add(item); Cart cart = api.getCartCreate().call(request);
        See Also:
        http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/CartCreate.html

      • getBrowseNodeLookup

        public BrowseNodeLookupCall getBrowseNodeLookup()
        Returns the ApiCall object for doing a browse node lookup. Amazon is structured in a hierarchy of browse nodes. BrowseNodeLookupRequest request = new BrowseNodeLookupRequest(); request.getBrowseNodeId().add("78689031"); BrowseNodes nodes = api.getBrowseNodeLookup().call(request);
        See Also:
        http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/BrowseNodeLookup.html

      • getItemLookup

        public ItemLookupCall getItemLookup()
        Returns the ApiCall object for doing an item lookup. ItemLookupRequest request = new ItemLookupRequest(); request.getItemId().add("383102037X"); Items items = api.getItemLookup().call(request);
        See Also:
        http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/ItemLookup.html

      • getSimilarityLookup

        public SimilarityLookupCall getSimilarityLookup()
        Returns the ApiCall object for finding similar items. Similarity is a measurement of similar items purchased, that is, customers who bought X also bought Y and Z. It is not a measure, for example, of items viewed, that is, customers who viewed X also viewed Y and Z. SimilarityLookupRequest request = new SimilarityLookupRequest(); request.getItemId().add("383102037X"); Items items = api.getSimilarityLookup().call(request);
        See Also:
        http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/SimilarityLookup.html

      • getItemSearch

        public ItemSeachCall getItemSearch()
        Returns the ApiCall object for searching items ItemSearchRequest request = new ItemSearchRequest(); request.setSearchIndex("Books"); request.setKeywords("Star Wars"); Items items = api.getItemSearch().call(request);
        See Also:
        http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/latest/DG/ItemSearch.html
